narrative.title: Eighth Army 8Th Army - 1942Q3
narrative.situation: British Field Army deployed in North Africa during 1942Q3.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Coastal defensive line (El Alamein to Qattara Depression). Northern sector: coastal plain with defensive ridges (Ruweisat, Alam Nayil, Miteirya). Southern sector: Qattara Depression (impassable salt marsh) anchors flank. Terrain favors defense - limited frontage (40 miles) cannot be outflanked

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

environment.terrain_type: Coastal defensive line (El Alamein to Qattara Depression). Northern sector: coastal plain with defensive ridges (Ruweisat, Alam Nayil, Miteirya). Southern sector: Qattara Depression (impassable salt marsh) anchors flank. Terrain favors defense - limited frontage (40 miles) cannot be outflanked

aggregate_strength.note: Aggregate strength from Wikipedia Second Battle of El Alamein (October-November 1942: 730-750 aircraft, using midpoint 740). Squadron details from Nafziger Collection (1 September 1942). Per-squadron strength estimated using RAF standard establishment.

air_support.organizational_summary: 37 operational units providing air support to ground forces

source.title: British Western Desert Air Force, 1 September 1942

air_support.integration_note: Air forces data integrated from quarterly air summary. See british_1942q3_air_summary.json for detailed squadron/gruppo breakdown.
